translation: The guns boom and produce roaring sounds. 30
The Mother (goddess) challenges and the wounds bust.
The youthful warriors fight and the horses dance.31

gurmukhi: ਧਾੲਿਓ ਅਸੁਰੇਂਦ੍ਰੁ ਤਹ ਨਿਜ ਕੋਪ ਓਪ ਬਢਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Dhaaio Asurendr(u) Tah Nij Kop Op Badhaae||
translation: With increased anger, the demon-king sped forward.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਗ ਲੈ ਚਤੁਰੰਗ ਸੈਨਾ ਸੁੱਧ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਚਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: San Lai Chaturan Sainaa Suddh Sastra Nachaae||
translation: He had four kinds of forces with him, who cause the dance of sharp weapons.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਬਿ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਲਗੈ ਗਿਰੇ ਰਣ ਰੁੱਝਿ ਜੁੱਝਿ ਜੁਅਾਣ ||
transliteration: Deb(i) Sastra Lagad Gire Ran Rujjh(i) Jujjh(i) Juaan||
translation: Whosoever was struck by the weapons of the goddess, those fighting warriors fell in the field.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਲ ਰਾਜ ਫਿਰੇ ਕਹੂੰ ਰਣ ਸੁੱਛ ਛੁੱਛ ਕਿਕਾਣ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Pool Raaj Phire Kahoon Ran Souchchh Chhouchchh Kikaan||32||
translation: Somewhere the elephants and somewhere horses are roaming without riders in the battlefield.32.

gurmukhi: ਚੀਰ ਚਾਮਰ ਪੁੰਜ ਕੁੰਜਰ ਬਾਜ ਰਾਜ ਅਨੇਕ ||
transliteration: Choor Chaamar Pounj Kounjar Baaj Raaj Anek||
translation: Somewhere clothes, turbans and fly-whisks are lying scattered and somewhere elephants, horses and chieftains are lying dead.

gurmukhi: ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੁਭੇ ਕਹੂੰ ਸਰਦਾਰ ਸੁਅਾਰ ਅਨੇਕ ||
transliteration: Sastra Astra Soubhe Kahoon Sardaar Suaar Anek||
translation: Somewhere generals and warriors with weapons and aromuts are lying down.

gurmukhi: ਤੇਗ ਤੀਰ ਤੁਫੰਗ ਤਬਰ ਕੁਹੁਕ ਬਾਣ ਅਨੰਤ ||
transliteration: Teg Toor Touphan Tabar Kuhouk Baan Anant||
translation: Somewhere the sonund of arrows, swords, guns, axes and special shafts is being heard.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਧਿ ਬੇਧਿ ਗਿਰੇ ਬਰੱਛਿਨ ਸੂਰ ਸੋਭਾਵੰਤ ||੩੩||
transliteration: Bedh(i) Bedh(i) Gire Barachchhin Soor Sobhaavant||33||
translation: Somewhere the heroes pierced by the daggers have fallen gracefully.33.

gurmukhi: ਗ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧ ੳੁਡੇ ਤਹਾ ਫਿਕਰੰਤ ਸੁਅਾਨ ਸ੍ਰਿੰਗਾਲ ||
transliteration: Griddh Briddh Ude Tahaa Phikrant Suaan Sringadl||
translation: Large-sized vultures are flying there, the dogs are barking and the jackals are howling.

gurmukhi: ਮੱਤ ਦੰਤ ਸਪੱਛ ਪੱਬੈ ਕੰਕ ਬੰਕ ਰਸਾਲ ||
transliteration: Matt Dant Spachchh Pabbai Kank Bank Rasaal||
translation: The intoxicated elephants look like the winged mountains and the crows, flying down to eat the flesh.
